description.compact: Main Holder page for Recipes

docblock.description: which can be used by the client.

description.compact: OPTION 1: API KEY!
OPTION 2: OAUTH OPTION
OPTION 2: OAUTH OPTION
OPTION 2: OAUTH OPTION
must be called to use this API.
turn debug on or off
provides the Authorisation Array
returns the result or NULL in case of an error

return.description: | Null

description.compact: returns the HTTP code for the response.

docblock.description: This can be handy for debuging purposes.

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: array( { 'WebVersionURL' => The web version url of the campaign 'WebVersionTextURL' => The web version url of the text version of the campaign 'CampaignID' => The id of the campaign 'Subject' => The campaign subject 'Name' => The name of the campaign 'FromName' => The from name for the campaign 'FromEmail' => The from email address for the campaign 'ReplyTo' => The reply to email address for the campaign 'SentDate' => The sent data of the campaign 'TotalRecipients' => The number of recipients of the campaign }

description.compact: Gets all subscriber lists the current client has created

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Creates a new list based on the provided details.

docblock.description: Both the UnsubscribePage and the ConfirmationSuccessPage parameters are optional

param.description: - the page to redirect subscribers to when they unsubscribeThe list title
- The page to redirect subscribers to when they unsubscribe
- Whether this list requires confirmation of subscription
- The page to redirect subscribers to when they confirm their subscription

- Unsubscribe setting must be CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS or CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ONLY_THIS_LIST. See the documentation for details: http://www.campaignmonitor.com/api/lists/#creating_a_list

return.description: A successful response will be the ID of the newly created list

comment.value: we need to do this afterwards otherwise the definition below

description.compact: Creates custom field for list

param.description: - list ID
- type of custom field
- field type
- options for dropdown field type

return.description: A successful response will be the key of the newly created custom field

description.compact: Creates custom field for list

param.description: - list ID

description.compact: Deletes an existing list from the system

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Gets the basic details of the current list

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ListID' => The id of the list 'Title' => The title of the list 'UnsubscribePage' => The page which subscribers are redirected to upon unsubscribing 'ConfirmedOptIn' => Whether the list is Double-Opt In 'ConfirmationSuccessPage' => The page which subscribers are redirected to upon confirming their subscription 'UnsubscribeSetting' => The unsubscribe setting for the list. Will be either CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS or CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ONLY_THIS_LIST. }

description.compact: Gets all active subscribers added since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all unconfirmed subscribers added since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all bounced subscribers who have bounced out since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all unsubscribed subscribers who have unsubscribed since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Updates the details of an existing list Both the UnsubscribePage and the ConfirmationSuccessPage parameters are optional

param.description: - he page to redirect subscribers to when they unsubscribeThe list title
- The page to redirect subscribers to when they unsubscribe
- Whether this list requires confirmation of subscription
- The page to redirect subscribers to when they confirm their subscription

- Unsubscribe setting must be CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS or CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ONLY_THIS_LIST. See the documentation for details: http://www.campaignmonitor.com/api/lists/#creating_a_list
- When UnsubscribeSetting is CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS, whether unsubscribes from this list should be added to the suppression list.
- When UnsubscribeSetting is CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS, whether active subscribers should be scrubbed against the suppression list.

return.description: A successful response will be empty

comment.value: we need to do this afterwards otherwise the definition below

description.compact: Gets statistics for list subscriptions, deletions, bounces and unsubscriptions

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets a summary of all campaign reporting statistics

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'Recipients' => The total recipients of the campaign 'TotalOpened' => The total number of opens recorded 'Clicks' => The total number of recorded clicks 'Unsubscribed' => The number of recipients who unsubscribed 'Bounced' => The number of recipients who bounced 'UniqueOpened' => The number of recipients who opened 'WebVersionURL' => The url of the web version of the campaign 'WebVersionTextURL' => The url of the web version of the text version of the campaign 'WorldviewURL' => The public Worldview URL for the campaign 'Forwards' => The number of times the campaign has been forwarded to a friend 'Likes' => The number of times the campaign has been 'liked' on Facebook 'Mentions' => The number of times the campaign has been tweeted about 'SpamComplaints' => The number of recipients who marked the campaign as spam }

description.compact: Gets the email clients that subscribers used to open the campaign

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all unsubscribes recorded for a campaign since the provided date

param.description: ID of the Campaign
The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ResultsOrderedBy' => The field the results are ordered by 'OrderDirection' => The order direction 'PageNumber' => The page number for the result set 'PageSize' => The page size used 'RecordsOnThisPage' => The number of records returned 'TotalNumberOfRecords' => The total number of records available 'NumberOfPages' => The total number of pages for this collection 'Results' => array( { 'EmailAddress' => The email address of the subscriber who unsubscribed 'ListID' => The list id of the list containing the subscriber 'Date' => The date of the unsubscribe 'IPAddress' => The ip address where the unsubscribe originated } ) }

description.compact: Gets the lists across a client to which a subscriber with a particular email address belongs.

param.description: | Member $email Subscriber's email address (or Member)

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Adds a new subscriber to the specified list

param.description: The subscriber details to use during creation.
Whether we should resubscribe this subscriber if they already exist in the list
Whether we should restart subscription based auto responders which are sent when the subscriber first subscribes to a list.

docblock.param: NOTE that for the custom fields they need to be formatted like this: Array( 'Key' => The custom fields personalisation tag 'Value' => The value for this subscriber 'Clear' => true/false (pass true to remove this custom field. in the case of a [multi-option, select many] field, pass an option in the 'Value' field to clear that option or leave Value blank to remove all options) )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Updates an existing subscriber (email, name, state, or custom fields) in the specified list.

docblock.description: The update is performed even for inactive subscribers, but will return an error in the event of the given email not existing in the list.

param.description: The subscriber details to use during creation.
Whether we should resubscribe this subscriber if they already exist in the list
Whether we should restart subscription based auto responders which are sent when the subscriber first subscribes to a list.

docblock.param: NOTE that for the custom fields they need to be formatted like this: Array( 'Key' => The custom fields personalisation tag 'Value' => The value for this subscriber 'Clear' => true/false (pass true to remove this custom field. in the case of a [multi-option, select many] field, pass an option in the 'Value' field to clear that option or leave Value blank to remove all options) )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Updates an existing subscriber (email, name, state, or custom fields) in the specified list.

docblock.description: The update is performed even for inactive subscribers, but will return an error in the event of the given email not existing in the list.

param.description: - list of mebers
The subscriber details to use during creation. Each array item needs to have the same key as the member ID - e.g. array( 123 => array( [custom fields here] ), 456 => array( [custom fields here] ) )
we should resubscribe any existing subscribers
default, subscription based auto responders do not trigger during an import. Pass a value of true to override this behaviour
default, subscription based auto responders will not be restarted

docblock.param: NOTE that for the custom fields they need to be formatted like this: Array( 'Key' => The custom fields personalisation tag 'Value' => The value for this subscriber 'Clear' => true/false (pass true to remove this custom field. in the case of a [multi-option, select many] field, pass an option in the 'Value' field to clear that option or leave Value blank to remove all options) )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

param.description: | String $member - email address or Member Object

return.description: A successful response will be empty
